* Elliotte Harold <elharo@...> [2007-07-17 01:00]:
> You're not supposed to put stuff arbitrary JavaScript into
> JSON, but people can and do.

Then it’s not JSON anymore and JSON parsers will choke on it.
JSON is a computation-free subset of Javascript.

(If you wanted to parse it using `eval` in Javascript, you’d need
something like Perl’s `Safe` module, which lets the host code
pick VM ops to allow or forbid prior to invoking untrusted code.)

> eval-able formats are dangerous. Formats that mix data and code
> are dangerous. That's the bottom line.

Billion laughs.

And before you retort, consider whether anything you say is
inapplicable to JSON.

Regards,
-- 
Aristotle Pagaltzis // <http://plasmasturm.org/>
